Header: Black box of crashed Indonesian Lion Air plane found
Content: Indonesian search teams discovered a black box, the landing gear, and some other wreckages of the Indonesian Lion Air plane that crashed into the sea off western Indonesia last Monday. Chief investigator of the Indonesian National Transportation Safety Committee Marjono Siswosuwarno said they have recovered the flight data recorder . Efforts were underway to search for the other black box, the cockpit voice recorder , but the mission was hampered by strong underwater current. As of Thursday, 65 bodies of the victims have been found. The Boeing 737 Max 8 jet en route to the city of Pangkal Pinang with 189 people on board was reported missing Monday morning, and was believed to have crashed 13 minutes after taking off from Jakartaâ€™s Soekarno-Hatta international airport.
